stanford.name: Stanford University
stanford.description: Stanford University is a private research university in Stanford, California. Stanford is known for its academic strength, wealth, proximity to Silicon Valley, and ranking as one of the world's top universities.
stanford.key_application: Highly selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, Personal Qualities; Optional: Interview, Demonstrated Interest; Not Considered: State Residency, AP/IB Scores, Legacy

mit.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
mit.description: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology is a private research university in Cambridge, Massachusetts. The institute is a land-grant, sea-grant, and space-grant university, with an urban campus that extends more than a mile alongside the Charles River.
mit.key_application: Highly selective: GPA, SAT/ACT, Subject Tests (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, STEM focus; Optional: Interview, Portfolio (for specific programs)

caltech.name: California Institute of Technology
caltech.description: The California Institute of Technology is a private research university in Pasadena, California. Caltech has six academic divisions with strong emphases on science and engineering.
caltech.key_application: Highly selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), STEM-focused Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations; Optional: Interviews, STEM Subject Tests

harvard.name: Harvard University
harvard.description: Harvard University is a private Ivy League research university in Cambridge, Massachusetts. Established in 1636 and named for its first benefactor, clergyman John Harvard, Harvard is the United States' oldest institution of higher learning.
harvard.key_application: Highly selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, Leadership Qualities; Optional: Interviews, Legacy, Demonstrated Interest

yale.name: Yale University
yale.description: Yale University is a private Ivy League research university in New Haven, Connecticut. Founded in 1701 as the Collegiate School, it is the third-oldest institution of higher education in the United States and one of the nine Colonial Colleges chartered before the American Revolution.
yale.key_application: Highly selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, Leadership; Optional: Interview, Demonstrated Interest

princeton.name: Princeton University
princeton.description: Princeton University is a private Ivy League research university in Princeton, New Jersey. Founded in 1746 in Elizabeth as the College of New Jersey, Princeton is the fourth-oldest institution of higher education in the United States and one of the nine Colonial Colleges chartered before the American Revolution.
princeton.key_application: Highly selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, Leadership; Optional: Interview, Portfolio

columbia.name: Columbia University
columbia.description: Columbia University is a private Ivy League research university in New York City. Established in 1754 as King's College on the grounds of Trinity Church in Manhattan, Columbia is the oldest institution of higher education in New York and the fifth-oldest institution of higher learning in the United States.
columbia.key_application: Highly selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, Leadership; Optional: Interview, Demonstrated Interest

upenn.name: University of Pennsylvania
upenn.description: The University of Pennsylvania is a private Ivy League research university in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The university claims a founding date of 1740 and is one of the nine colonial colleges chartered prior to the U.S. Declaration of Independence.
upenn.key_application: Highly selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, Leadership Qualities; Optional: Interview, Legacy, Demonstrated Interest

berkeley.name: UC Berkeley
berkeley.description: UC Berkeley is a very prestigious university and also one of the top UC schools. This school has a variety of subjects but focuses more on STEM and economics.
berkeley.key_application: Selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations; Not Considered: Interviews, Legacy, Demonstrated Interest

cornell.name: Cornell University
cornell.description: Cornell University is a very prestigious university that is located in New York that has a large number of programs for undergraduate and graduate students. It is a very good school for engineering, biology, agriculture, architecture, and hotel administration.
cornell.key_application: Selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, Demonstrated Interest; Optional: Interview

johnhopkins.name: John Hopkins University
johnhopkins.description: Johns Hopkins University is a private research university and was also the first American university based on the European research institution model.
johnhopkins.key_application: Selective: GPA, SAT/ACT (optional), Extracurriculars, Essays, Recommendations, Research Experience; Optional: Interview

oxford.name: University of Oxford
oxford.description: Oxford University is a prestigious British university in a city called Oxford. This university focuses mainly on literature and is sometimes said to be the oldest English-speaking university because it was established in 1096.
oxford.key_application: Highly selective: GCSEs, A-levels or IB, Personal Statement, Written Tests (depending on the subject), Interviews; Optional: Extracurriculars (not prioritized)
